info.title: New public APIs
info.description: New public APIs currently offering manual rules and templates functionality

tags.name: Manual rules
tags.description:
This resource represents manually triggered rules. Use this to search for and invoke 
manual rules.

tags.name: Rule management
tags.description:
This resource represents rule management operations. Use this to:
- search for rule summaries
- get and create a rule
- update and enable/disable a rule

tags.name: Templates
tags.description:
This resource represents automation templates. Use this to search for templates, and 
create rules from a template.

servers.description: Primary entry point. Accepts API token authentication.

product.description: The product the API request is targetting

cloudid.description: The cloud ID of the site the API request is targetting.

servers.description: Site-specific entry point. Accepts API token authentication and browser session auth.

siteurl.description: The site base URL of the site the API request is targetting.

product.description: The product the API request is targetting

cloudid.description: The cloud ID of the site the API request is targetting.

get.description:
Search for manually-triggered rules using the given query params.

**Note:** Currently only `cursor` is allowed as parameter for the GET operation. 
Use the POST operation to perform the initial search.

**Deprecated:** The `links` field in the response body has recently changed to return just the query parameters instead of absolute links. See [the changelog notice](/cloud/automation/api/changelog/#1-august-2025).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
The pagination cursor to use to fetch a page of results.

Cursors are obtained via requests to the search API and should not be constructed manually.

200.description:
Return the manual rules that match the query AND 
the requesting user has permissions for.

400.description: No query fields provided, or unsupported object type in query.

403.description:
User is not authenticated, or user is not permitted to 
fetch rules for the given target object.

post.description:
Search for manually-triggered rules using the given criteria via POST.

Currently only `issue` and `alert` objects are supported.

**Deprecated:** The `links` field in the response body has recently changed to return just the query parameters instead of absolute links. See [the changelog notice](/cloud/automation/api/changelog/#1-august-2025).

200.description:
Return the manual rules that match the query AND 
the requesting user has permissions for.

400.description: No query fields provided, or unsupported object type in query.

403.description:
User is not authenticated, or user is not permitted to 
fetch rules for the given target object.

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The ID of the rule to invoke

post.description:
Invoke a manual rule with one or more target objects and optional inputs.
A rule will be executed for each target object provided.

requestBody.description:
Parameters to use when invoking the rule.

At least one target `object` is required. If the rule requires `userInputs` these are also required.

200.description:
Succesfully issued the invoke request.

Check the response body for individual execution results.

400.description: Invalid request payload, or inputs not valid for the rule.

403.description:
User is not authenticated, or user is not permitted to 
execute the rule for the given target object(s).

get.description:
Performs a request to retrieve the metadata associated with the provided template ID.
This includes any parameters the template has.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: The ID of the template to retrieve

400.description: Invalid template ID, or the template requested was not found.

get.description:
Search for templates rules using the given query params.

Accepts either a combination of filter parameters, or a cursor, but not both.

**Deprecated:** The `links` field in the response body has recently changed to return just the query parameters instead of absolute links. See [the changelog notice](/cloud/automation/api/changelog/#1-august-2025).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
The pagination cursor to use to fetch a page of results.

Cursors are obtained via requests to the search API and should not be constructed manually.

parameters.name: ruleHome
parameters.description:
If provided, only templates that apply to the ruleHome represented by the ARI will be returned.

Used to limit results to templates applicable for a given project or product etc.

200.description:
Return the templates that match the query AND 
the requesting user has permissions for.

400.description:
No query fields provided, or a combination of filter parameters and cursor were provided. 
Either cursor or a combination of filter parameters are permitted, but not both.

403.description:
User is not authenticated, or user is not permitted to 
fetch templates for the given ruleHome.

post.description:
Search for templates using the given criteria via POST.

Currently `categories` and `ruleHome ARI` filters are supported.

**Deprecated:** The `links` field in the response body has recently changed to return just the query parameters instead of absolute links. See [the changelog notice](/cloud/automation/api/changelog/#1-august-2025).

200.description:
Return the templates that match the query AND 
the requesting user has permissions for.

403.description:
User is not authenticated, or user is not permitted to 
fetch templates for the given target ruleHome ARI.

post.summary: Create a rule from a template
post.description: Create a rule from a template. This template may optionally accept parameters.

requestBody.description:
Parameters to use when creating the rule from the template.

If the rule has one or more `parameters`, values for these parameters are also required.

200.description: Succesfully created a rule from the provided template.

400.description: Invalid request payload, or parameter values are not valid for the template.

403.description:
User is not authenticated, or user is not permitted to 
create a rule for the given scope/template.

get.description:
Get rule summaries for all rules.

**Deprecated:** The `links` field in the response body has recently changed to return just the query parameters instead of absolute links. See [the changelog notice](/cloud/automation/api/changelog/#1-august-2025).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
The pagination cursor to use to fetch a page of results.

The first call should be made without a cursor. Cursors are returned in the response body 
and should not be constructed manually.

200.description: Return rule summaries for all rules.

403.description: User is not authenticated, or user is not a global admin.

post.description:
Get rule summaries for rules that match the given criteria via POST.

Supports filtering by trigger, rule state, and rule scope (single ARI).

**Deprecated:** The `links` field in the response body has recently changed to return just the query parameters instead of absolute links. See [the changelog notice](/cloud/automation/api/changelog/#1-august-2025).

requestBody.description:
Query parameters to search on.

At least one of trigger, state, scope, or limit must be present.

200.description: Return the rule summaries that match the query.

400.description: No query fields provided, or unsupported object type in query.

403.description: User is not authenticated, or user is not a global admin.

post.description:
Create a new rule from the provided Rule Payload.

If providing a UUID for your new rule, it must be unique and V7. The time-based nature of V7 will impact sorting and pagination of your rule.

Accepts a rule payload, which has the same structure as the get a rule by UUID response.

400.description: No request body provided, or unsupported values in request.

403.description: User is not authenticated, or user is not a global admin.

get.description:
Performs a request to retrieve the rule with the provided UUID.
This includes the rule payload, trigger, components, and other metadata.

parameters.name: ruleUuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the rule to retrieve

200.description: Return Rule Config for the specified rule

403.description: User is not authenticated, or user is not a global admin.

put.description:
Updates an existing rule by accepting a rule payload, which has the same structure as the get a rule by UUID response.
ComponentIds are only required for pre-existing components.
New components will be created or deleted as needed.

parameters.name: ruleUuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the rule to update

400.description: No request body provided, or unsupported values in request.

403.description: User is not authenticated, or user is not a global admin.

parameters.name: ruleUuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the rule to update

put.description: Enable or disable a rule by rule UUID.

400.description: No request body provided, or unsupported values in request.

403.description: User is not authenticated, or user is not a global admin.

parameters.name: ruleUuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the rule to update

put.description: Update the scope of a rule by UUID.

400.description: No request body provided, or unsupported values in request.

403.description: User is not authenticated, or user is not a global admin.

orderBy.name: orderBy
orderBy.description:
Optionally specify the field to order results by.
Use prefix '+' and '-' to denote 'ascending' or 'descending'.

PaginationLinks.title: Links
PaginationLinks.description:
The query parameters for the previous and next pages, if available.

**Deprecated:** This has recently changed to return just the query parameters instead of absolute links.
See [the changelog notice](/cloud/automation/api/changelog/#1-august-2025).

self.description: The query parameters for this page of results.

next.description: The query parameters for the next page of results, or null if not available.

prev.description: The query parameters for the previous page of results, or null if not available.

PaginatedResponse.description: An envelope for paginated responses using an opaque cursor for pagination.

allOf.title: Data
allOf.description: A page of data. May be empty if there is no data.

data.description: The data for this page of results

Error.title: Error
Error.description: A single error generated during an operation

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the error.  Can be used to correlate with logs.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this error.

code.description: A code that specifies the type of error.

title.description: The (translated) human-readable summary of the error.

detail.description: (Optional) Human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the error,  and a suggested action to resolve it.

field.description: (Optional) Field identifer for a field-based error.  Expressed as a field-path from the root of the object.

ErrorResponse.title: ErrorResponse
ErrorResponse.description: An error response containing one or more errors.

RuleScope.title: RuleScope
RuleScope.description: The set of resources or containers the rule is scoped to.

SearchManualRuleRequest.title: SearchManualRuleRequest
SearchManualRuleRequest.description: Params to use when fetching manual rules. Either "objects" or "cursor" is required, but not both.

oneOf.title: SearchManualRuleInitialRequest
oneOf.description: Params to use when fetching an initial page of manual rules.

objects.description:
The object(s) to fetch manual rules for. Must be a supported object type, 
and only one type of object is allowed for a single request.

Currently only `issue` and `alert` objects are supported.

limit.description: How many results to return per page of results

oneOf.title: SearchManualRuleWithCursorRequest
oneOf.description: Params to use when fetching a subsequent page of manual rules using a pagination cursor.

cursor.description: The pagination cursor to use to fetch more results

limit.description: How many results to return per page of results

SearchManualRuleResponse.title: SearchManualRuleResponse
SearchManualRuleResponse.description: Result of a manual rule search. Contains 0 or more results.

ManualTriggerInputPrompt.description: An input field that can be passed to a manual rule when invoking it.

displayName.description: The human-readable name for an input prompt

required.description:
Indicates if this input is required or not. 

Manual rule invocation will fail if a required input is missing.

variableName.description:
The name of the smart value variable this input will be 
available as when the rule executes

oneOf.description: A default value to use for TEXT and PARAGRAPH types
A default value to use for NUMBER types
A default value to use for BOOLEAN types
Values to use for DROPDOWN inputs

defaultValue.description: The default value that will be supplied if none is collected OR the list of valid values for a DROPDOWN input.

ManualTriggerInput.title: ManualTriggerInput
ManualTriggerInput.description: An input supplied to a manual rule during execution

value.description: The value to supply for the input

ManualTriggerRule.title: ManualTriggerRule
ManualTriggerRule.description: Details of a single manual rule, including what inputs are needed to execute it.

userInputs.description: Inputs to pass to the rule when executing

InvokeManualRuleRequest.title: InvokeManualRuleRequest
InvokeManualRuleRequest.description:
Parameters to supply when invoking a manual rule.

At least one `object` is required. If the rule requires inputs these are also required.

At present only `issue` and `alert` objects are allowed.

objects.description:
The object(s) to execute the rule against.

Only `issue` and `alert` objects are allowed, and only one type is allowed per request 
(e.g. all `issue` or all `alert`). All `objects` must come from the same container (e.g. the same `project` in the case of `issue`).

userInputs.description: Inputs to supply to the rule, if required, keyed by input name.

ManualRuleCreateExecutionResult.title: ManualRuleCreateExecutionResult
ManualRuleCreateExecutionResult.description:
The result of an invocation of a manual rule for a single `object`.
* `SUCCESS` - The invocation was successful and the rule will execute.
* `INVALID_TARGET_OBJECT` - The invocation failed because the target `object` is not valid for the rule
* `INVALID_RULE_OR_OBJECT` - The invocation failed because the rule given cannot be invoked with the given `object` OR the rule is in a state that can't be invoked (e.g. `disabled`)
* `INVALID_LICENSE` - The invocation failed because rule execution limits have been reached
* `INVALID_TARGET_SCOPE` - The invocation failed because the provided `object` is not in the same scope as the rule

**Note**: A `SUCCESS` result only indicates that the invocation was successful. It does not indicate that the rule executed successfully.

InvokeManualRuleResponse.title: InvokeManualRuleResponse
InvokeManualRuleResponse.description:
Invocation results, keyed by object ARI, indicating if the invocation was successful or not. 

It is possible for an invocation to fail if, for example, the provided target `object` is not valid
for the rule being invoked.

Template.title: Template
Template.description: Details of a single template, including what parameters are required to create a rule from the template.

description.example: When a task is near due -> send an email to the Assignee of the task

parameters.description: The list of parameters this template accepts upon rule creation.

displayMetadata.title: DisplayMetadata
displayMetadata.description: Metadata necessary for displaying the template in the UI (e.g. icon names).

triggerIcons.description: The list of trigger icon names.

actionIcons.description: The list of action icon names.

TemplateCategory.title: TemplateCategory
TemplateCategory.description: Details of a single category, including its underlying key and display name

key.description: The lookup key of the category, as used in the search operation

displayName.description: The translated display name of the category, as per the request's Locale.

SearchTemplatesRequest.title: SearchTemplatesRequest
SearchTemplatesRequest.description:
Perform a search request for templates according to a set of filters.
Currently, the list of supported filters is:
  - Category key(s)
  - Home ARI
An empty set of filters will return the whole list of templates.

Either a combination of "categories" and "home" or a cursor are required, but not both.

categories.description: The list of category keys to filter on

ruleHome.description:
If provided, only templates that apply to the ruleHome (represented by ARI) will be returned.
Used to limit results to templates applicable for a given project or product etc.

limit.description: How many entries to return per page of results

cursor.description: The pagination cursor used to fetch more entries

limit.description: How many entries to return per page of results

SearchTemplatesResponse.title: SearchTemplatesResponse
SearchTemplatesResponse.description: Result of a templates search. Contains 0 or more entries.

CreateRuleFromTemplateRequest.title: CreateRuleFromTemplateRequest
CreateRuleFromTemplateRequest.description: Params to use when creating a rule from a template.

templateId.description: The template ID matching the template the rule will be created from

ruleHome.description: Specifies the scope to create the rule under.

parameters.description:
The parameters used to set certain values in the rule config when created.
Some templates require parameters.

CreateRuleFromTemplateResponse.title: CreateRuleFromTemplateResponse
CreateRuleFromTemplateResponse.description: Result of a rule creation from a template.

ruleId.description: The ruleId property, which matches the newly created rule, is deprecated and will be removed soon. Please use the ruleUuid property instead

ruleUuid.description: The uuid matching the newly created rule.

CreateRuleFromTemplateParameter.title: CreateRuleFromTemplateParameter
CreateRuleFromTemplateParameter.description: Specifies a parameter to be supplied when creating a rule from a template.

key.description: A unique key for the parameter

required.description: Indicates whether the parameter value is required for rule creation

CreateRuleFromTemplateParameterType.title: CreateRuleFromTemplateParameterType
CreateRuleFromTemplateParameterType.description: The type of value provided at rule creation

CreateRuleFromTemplateParameterValue.title: CreateRuleFromTemplateParameterValue
CreateRuleFromTemplateParameterValue.description: A parameter supplied to a template when creating a rule

value.description: The value to supply for the parameter. Text values must have a maximum length of 5000 characters.

RuleSummaryResponse.title: RuleSummaryResponse
RuleSummaryResponse.description: Result of a rule summary search. Contains 0 or more results.

items.title: RuleSummary
items.description: A rule summary object containing the summarised details of a rule.

actorAccountId.description: The account ID of the actor of the rule, if a specific user is set as the actor.

authorAccountId.description: The account ID of the author of the rule.

created.description: The time that the rule was created.

updated.description: The time that the rule was last updated.

labels.description: The IDs of the labels attached to the rule.

SearchRuleApiRequest.title: SearchRuleApiRequest
SearchRuleApiRequest.description: Params to use when fetching rule summaries.

cursor.description: The pagination cursor to use to fetch more results

trigger.description: The trigger used in the rule.

author.title: AccountId
author.description: A user account ID. See [the guide](/cloud/automation/resources/how-to-get-user-account-IDs/) for how to get a user's account id.

limit.description: Number of results to return per page.

RuleStateUpdateRequest.title: RuleStateUpdateRequest
RuleStateUpdateRequest.description: An object containing the desired state of the rule.

RuleScopeUpdateRequest.title: RuleScopeUpdateRequest
RuleScopeUpdateRequest.description: An object to overwrite the existing scope for the rule.

ruleScopeARIs.title: ruleScopeARIs
ruleScopeARIs.description:
The ARIs representing the scopes you want the rule to trigger for.

See [the guide](/cloud/automation/resources/how-to-get-rule-scope-ARIs/) on how to find the correct ARIs for your rule.

connectionTargetKey.description: The connection key for the target site.

targetConfigJson.description: JSON containing information on the connection's target site.

createdAt.description: The time that the connection was created.

updatedAt.description: The time that the connection was last updated.

id.description: The UUID of the rule the connection belongs to.

rule.description: The configuration payload for creating a rule.

uuid.description: The UUID to use for the created rule. If a rule with that UUID already exists, the request will fail.

rule.title: CreateRulePayload

connections.title: RuleWriteConnections
connections.description:
The connections to create for the rule.

For connections that use OAuth, the connection will not work unless access has already been granted. 
In order to grant access, create the desired component through the UI and you will be prompted to grant 
Automation access. This only needs to be done once.

**Note:** Connections will only be authenticated if the connection is owned by the requesting user.
If the connection does not have an account ID, or the account ID does not match the requesting user, then the
rule will be **disabled** on creation/update and an unauthenticated connection is created for the rule
which cannot be used. The rule cannot be enabled until all connections used by components are authenticated 
(via the UI, or by updating the rule via the API with connections the requesting user owns).

id.description:
The UUID of the connection.

This needs to be generated by the caller, then inserted into the components `connectionId` field so
that the components use the correct connection.

connectionTargetKey.description: The connection key for the target site. To get the correct key, export a rule with the desired connection.

targetConfigJson.description: JSON string containing information on the connection's target site. To get the correct shape, export a rule with the desired connection.

RuleUpdateRequest.description: An object containing the configurations changes to apply to an existing rule.

rule.description: The configuration payload for updating a rule.
rule.title: RulePayload

RuleUpdateRequest.title: RuleUpdateRequest

ComponentConfigCreateDTO.description: The catch-all configuration for a component in a rule, which can be any type of component (branch, condition, action, etc.).

value.description: The component's configuration value. To get the expected shape for a specific component, export a rule containing the component.

ComponentConfigCreateDTO.title: ComponentConfigCreateDTO

ComponentConfigDTO.description: The catch-all configuration for a component in a rule, which can be any type of component (branch, condition, action, etc.).

id.description: Optional for update requests. If specified, the existing component with that id will be updated. If no id is provided, a new component will be created.

value.description: The component's configuration value. To get the expected shape for a specific component, export a rule containing the component.

ComponentConfigDTO.title: ComponentConfigDTO

TriggerConfigCreateDTO.description: The configuration for a trigger component in a rule.

value.description: The component's configuration value. To get the expected shape for a specific component, export a rule containing the component.

TriggerConfigCreateDTO.title: TriggerConfigCreateDTO

TriggerConfigDTO.description: The configuration for a trigger component in a rule.

id.description: Optional for update requests. If specified, the existing component with that id will be updated. If no id is provided, a new component will be created.

connectionId.description: The UUID of the connection to use for the component.
connectionId.title: ComponentConfigId

type.description: The component identifier. To get a component's type, export a rule containing the component.
type.title: Type

value.description: The component's configuration value. To get the expected shape for a specific component, export a rule containing the component.

TriggerConfigDTO.title: TriggerConfigDTO

AuthType.description: The authentication type used for the connection.

documents.title: About
documents.body:
This is the reference for the Automation REST API. 
This API is the primary way to get and modify data in Automation across products. 
Use it to interact with Automation entities, like rules.

documents.title: Authentication and authorization
documents.body:
**Authentication:** Authentication requires an API token or browser session cookies.

**Authorization:** Authorization is based on the user making the request and the product-level permissions they have that relate to the entities they are interacting with.

See [Authentication](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/automation/security/authentication/) or [Authorization](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/automation/security/authorization/) for more details.

documents.title: Status codes
Pagination
documents.body:
The Automation REST API uses cursor-based pagination: a method that returns a response with multiple objects can only return a limited number at one time. 
This limits the size of responses and conserves server resources.

Use the 'limit' parameter to specify the desired number of results per page.

If more results are available after the initial page a `links` section will include an opaque `cursor` that can be used request the next page of results.

Cursors are opaque and not intended to be constructed by an API consumer. Consumers must treat them as opaque strings. 
The format of a cursor may change at any time and is not part of our API contract.

Cursors have a TTL after which they will not be valid for use. For most APIs this is 1 hour.

documents.title: Versioning
documents.body:
The Automation REST API path-based versioning.

The API version is included in the request path e.g. `/rest/v1/rule/manual/search`.

A special version `latest` is an alias to the most recent version of a particular operation e.g.  `/rest/latest/rule/manual/search`.
